Additional Resources

Literacy Information and Communication System (LINCS)
LINCS is a national leadership initiative of the U.S. Department of Education, Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education (OCTAE), to expand evidence-based practice in the field of adult education. The following resources may be helpful for further learning: 

  • Teaching Skills That Matter in Adult Education
  • LINCS ESL Pro Resource Collection 
  • Employability Skills Framework 
  • TEAL Center Fact Sheet No. 8: Effective Lesson Planning
  • Teacher Effectiveness in Adult Education 
  • Learning to Achieve
  • Digital Literacy Initiative
  • College and Career Readiness Standards in Action
  • Introduction to English Language Proficiency Standards for Adult Education
  • Integrated Education and Training Toolkit 
  • Designing and Delivering Career Pathways at Community Colleges: A Practice Guide for Educators
  • LINCS Community of Practice: Career Pathways
